description: From Old French ditan (French dictame), from Latin dictamnum, from Ancient Greek δίκταμνον (díktamnon), reportedly from Δικτή (Diktḗ, “Dicte”), a mountain in Crete on whose slopes the plant grew.

entries.meaning: A labiate plant, Origanum dictamnus, formerly renowned for its medicinal properties; dittany of Crete.
A fragrant plant in the rue family, Dictamnus albus
examples: Synonym: fraxinella, gas plant, burning bush

entries.meaning: Pseudodictamnus mediterraneus (syn. Ballota pseudodictamnus; false dittany)
(US) A fragrant herb in the mint family native to the eastern US, Cunila origanoides
examples: Synonym: common dittany, stone mint, frost mint, American dittany
